description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Database, Applications and Systems Infrastructure is part of Corporate Engineering-Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). We provide SRE support to Enterprise applications within Google, powering key verticals such as Finance, Legal, Supply Chain, and HR. Our mission is to deliver service excellence with engineering, innovation and customer focus and transform Google's enterprise domain.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of program development and project management experience in the enterprise software/services space.
  • Experience deploying enterprise scale services on cloud infrastructures.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with solving complex system issues and technical innovation. Experience with change and aligning diverse technical teams with different perspectives.
  • Experience in leading SAP implementation projects.
  • Leadership experience with cross-functional, multidisciplinary project teams.
  • Background in one or more of the following areas: SAP implementation, data center infrastructure, system administration, service management modernization.
  • Demonstrated ability to present technical materials effectively to diverse stakeholder groups and to engage with executives of large enterprises on both technical and non-technical matters.
  • Demonstrated project management discipline, sprint planning, and roadmap development.
responsibilities:
• Lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple simultaneous projects with competing priorities. Interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
  • Utilize various project management techniques as appropriate to deliver.
  • Provide technical direction for existing and future corporate application infrastructure, including third-party developed business critical and highly complex applications.
  • Handle data collection, automation challenges, and infrastructure design.
  • Perform operational forecasting, capacity planning, and oversee continuous improvement of infrastructure delivery to ensure implementation meets current and future business needs. Identify metrics and drive initiatives to improve the quality of Google services.
title: Program Manager, Database, Apps and Systems Infrastructure
